pageContext.claim: “We’re the number one economy in the world. It’s picked up tremendously in the last three years since I've been here.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often credits himself with an economic "turn-around" or the "great American comeback." But many of the positive trends in Trump’s economy follows the trends set by the last years of Obama’s economy. The historical books are going to view the actions taken in 2008 and 2009 by George W. Bush and Obama — and the Federal Reserve — as pivotal to saving the U.S. economy. Trump has exceeded expectations on jobs and economic growth that were in place at the start of 2017. That’s due in part because of his tax cut, but also because of factors largely beyond his control, such as the increase in oil prices.
